description: a(n) = a(n-1) - n if a(n-1) > n, else a(n) = a(n-1) + n.
comments: Variation (1) on Recamán's sequence A005132.a(A134931(n-1)) = 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 31 2013

Index entries for sequences related to Recamán's sequence
formula: This is a concatenation S_0, S_1, S_2, ... where S_i = [b_0, b_1, ..., b_{k-1}], k=5*3^i, with b_0 = 1, b_{2j} = k+j, b_{2j+1} = (k+1)/2-j. E.g., S_0 = [1, 3, 6, 2, 7].For any m>=1, for k such that 5*3^k+3>12m, a((5*3^k+3-12*m)/6)= m. For example, for k>=1, a((5*3^k-9)/6) = 1. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 31 2002
maple: A046901 := proc(n) option remember; if n = 1 then 1 else if A046901(n-1)>n then A046901(n-1)-n else A046901(n-1)+n; fi; fi; end;
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n<2,1,a(n-1)-if(sign(n-a(n-1))+1,-1,1)*n);(Haskell)a046901 n = a046901_list !! (n-1)a046901_list = scanl1 (\u v -> if u > v then u - v else u + v) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 07 2015, Jan 31 2013
